If you call Combo.select(index) with an index value out of range, it is supposed 
to ignore the call according to the javadoc.  However on Linux it throws a 
SWT.ERROR_INVALID_RANGE error.

To reproduce the bug, create a Combo widget and call select(0) before having any 
items in it.  You'll get the following stack information:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Index out of bounds
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1687)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1741)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:262)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Combo.select(Combo.java:1049)

The javadoc for this method (and the deselect method) clearly says:
    Indices that are out of range are ignored.

The reason this is 'major' is because of the impact to porting code written 
originally for the Windows platform where this call is valid.  Now we get 
internal errors and have to retrofit code to check the input range before making 
these calls.
Fixed.  Such cases are now silently ignored.
*** Bug 9868 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
